title: Cavs' Garland, Mobley, Hunter back for Game 3
description: The Cavaliers got a much-needed lift with Darius Garland, Evan Mobley and De'Andre Hunter back for Game 3 on Friday night.
author: Jamal Collier

title: Riley not sorry on Butler call, eyes Heat overhaul
description: Addressing the Jimmy Butler situation for the first time since the forward was traded to the Warriors, Pat Riley said that he wishes Butler well. He also said he expects the Heat to make roster changes in the offseason.

title: 'The pretender replacing a legend - a new era dawns at Real Madrid'
description: Xabi Alonso will succeed Carlo Ancelotti as Real Madrid manager next season. Spanish football expert Guillem Balague looks at the challenges ahead.

title: Haaland 'ready and fit' to make Man City return
description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland is ready to make his return from injury against Southampton this weekend, manager Pep Guardiola says.

title: England would consider hosting IPL matches after season suspension
description: England would consider hosting Indian Premier League (IPL) matches if the England and Wales Cricket Board receives a request to help complete the tournament from the Indian and international cricket authorities, Sky Sports News understands.

title: 'Worth the wait' - Mount enjoys his best night at Man Utd
description: Mason Mount says it was worth the wait to finally ignite his Manchester United career after his two goals off the bench against Athletic Club secured their place in the Europa League final.

title: Vegas' Nicolas Roy fined but not suspended for cross-checking Edmonton's Trent Frederic in the face
description: Vegas Golden Knights forward Nicolas Roy was fined but not suspended Friday for cross-checking the Edmonton Oilers' Trent Frederic in the face in overtime of Game 2 of the second-round playoff series. The NHLâ€™s Department of Player Safety announced the fine of $7,813, the maximum allowed under the collective bargaining agreement, after a disciplinary hearing with him. Roy was ejected with a five-minute match penalty for his two-handed stick to Frederic after a board battle with him 5 1/2 minutes into OT on Thursday night.

title: Thunder vs. Nuggets: Live updates, highlights for Friday's Game 3
description: Oklahoma City Thunder vs. Denver Nuggets: Live updates, highlights for Friday's Game 3.
